prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions** **1.1** Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole on one side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotations and no translation. **1.2** First, create the rectangular prism portion of the shape. Start by creating a new sketch on the XY plane. Draw a rectangle with corner points at (0,0) and (0.75, 0.25). Close the loop and exit the sketch. Extrude the sketch by 0.0938 units in the direction of the positive Z-axis. **1.3** Next, create the cylindrical hole on one side. Start by creating a new sketch on the XY plane. Draw a circle with its center at (0.125, 0.125) and a radius of 0.0312. Close the loop and exit the sketch. Create a new sketch on the side face of the prism where the circle should be. Use the first sketch as a reference to position the circle in the correct location. Extrude the circle through the thickness of the part. **1.4** The final dimensions of this part are 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.0938 units in height. **1.5** The rectangular prism has four faces, each made up of a single loop. There are three lines in each loop, with the exceptions of the two cylindrical holes, which each have a single loop consisting of a single circle. **1.6** The first sketch (face_1) consists of three lines and two circles. The first line starts at (0,0) and ends at (0.75,0). The second line starts at (0.75,0) and ends at (0.75,0.25). The third line starts at (0.75,0.25) and ends at (0,0.25). The fourth line starts at (0,0.25) and ends at (0,0). The two circles are located at (0.125,0.125) and (0.625,0.125) with a radius of 0.0312. **1.7** This part represents the base of the final assembly and will not be combined with any other parts using boolean operations.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 - Pyramid-shaped object Construct a pyramid-shaped object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees, and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.5, 0.0. 1.0. 2D Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 1.1. Face 1 * Loop 1 + Line 1: Create a line starting from 0.0, 0.0 and ending at 0.75, 0.0 + Line 2: Create a line starting from 0.75, 0.0 and ending at 0.375, 0.5 + Line 3: Create a line starting from 0.375, 0.5 and ending at 0.0, 0.5 + Line 4: Create a line starting from 0.0, 0.5 and ending at 0.0, 0.0, thus closing the loop. 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. 1.2.1. Apply a rotation of -90.0 degrees about the X-axis using the Euler angle. 1.2.2. Apply a translation of 0.0, 0.5, 0.0 using the translation vector. 1.2.3. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch_scale parameter. Extrusion Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model of the part. 1.3.1. Extrude the sketch by a distance of 0.5 towards the positive Z-axis, i.e., towards the positive normal. 1.3.2. Do not extrude the sketch by a distance of 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal. 1.3.3. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. 1.3.4. Perform NewBodyFeatureOperation, which results in the creation of a new solid body. Description The shape of this part is described as a three-dimensional geometric shape with a flat base and a tapered top, resembling a pyramid. The length of this part is 0.75, the width is 0.5, and the height is 0.75.</description>
